vectorData.altText: 28. Drag the correct descriptions of the epithelium onto the corresponding histological diagrams A & B. (Not all descriptions apply.)
Lines organs of the urinary system.
Lines organs of the urinary system.
Surface cell’s shape changes according to filling stage of the organ.
Surface cell’s shape changes according to filling stage of the organ.
Burn victims succumb their injury due to loss of this layer.
That's right!  Diagram A shows the transitional epithelium and B shows the stratified squamous non-keratinized epithelium.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer.

a stratified epithelium that lines surfaces which must allow stretch & recoil, such as the urinary bladder and ureter
surface cells are domed in shape, when the organ is empty and the epithelium is therefore not under tension.
cells flatten, epithelium appears to consist of fewer layers, as the organ fills and the epithelium must stretch

line external surfaces requiring protection from abrasion, pathogens, chemical attack
epidermal layer of the skin; it functions to prevent loss of body fluid by dehydration 
Undergoes process of keratinization

lines internal surfaces requiring protection from abrasion, pathogens, chemical attack
locations are logical, given its function in protection of underlying tissues; e.g. lining of mouth, throat, esophagus, rectum, anus, vagina, cervix
